title: Say Now
text:
Say Now  (formerly known as needanamebro) are a British girl group from London consisting of members Ysabelle Salvanera, Amelia Onuorah, and Madeleine Haynes.


== History ==
The group formed as a duo consisting of Salvanera and Onuorah, with Haynes joining the group in 2022 after their signing to Atlantic Records. The group are managed by Modest! Management, notable for managing the early careers of British pop groups One Direction and Little Mix. They gained attention online in 2022 with their cover of Drake's song "Massive". In 2023, the group released the singles "Better Love", "Not a Lot Left to Say", and "Netflix (Better Now Without You)". The UK's Official Charts Company praised "Not a Lot Left to Say", calling it a "breezy bop par excellence" and a contender for "song of the summer".
The group were untitled for their first year, releasing music under their temporary moniker needanamebro, but they unveiled their official name via social media on 25 July 2023. As well as the announcement of their name being Say Now, they released their debut extended play, Needanamebro. The track listing collated their singles released to date, as well as remixes, a snippet of a new song and their cover of "Massive".
At the 2024 Glamour Awards, the group won the Rising Star award.
